content: hey friends and fellow crafters today I have a prop with me and the prop is this
giant book called dungeon crawl classics now you can see this thing is huge
this this cover it's really an old-school type game and this cover
really inspired me to do a craft and as you can see I'll give you a closer look
it's a really neat door there with a stairs leading up to a ledge and I
thought this would be a really cool craft so let's go to the table I'll show
you a little bit of the completed craft and then we'll start working on it
so uh see you at the table hey Danny I want to give a huge
shout-out to you without people like you helping me support the craft I may not
be able to bring these videos to you so thanks again and I really appreciate it
alright guys I got my cheap dollar store from corn muse my compass and put it
round and on these two doors the doors are one inch wide each doors one inch
wide and then the side of the doors give me a half an inch so I just measured
from the center there it's going to mark it in a little darker so I can see it
easier with the pen and I've got the paper on still on the on the foam core
and then I'm gonna I measured up a half an inch and I'm gonna just do it by hand
do the top arch of the door okay and then just kind of fill that in and now
I'm ready to cut so I'll cut the door out easy just use an exacto knife and
cut cut the top frame of the door off good to go now let's cut the two doors
in half okay there we go now I want to make an identical door because you'll
see why I want to do this in a few minutes but I'm going to do this so I
can have the face part of the door and then the regular part of the door so
yeah and then just measure the center there each door is an inch and I'll just
cut those out okay now here's a picture of the front of the dungeon crawl
classics book you can see it has that neat stone face and I want to replicate
that on this cheap foam core so I'm gonna pull the paper off and that you
want to get the dollar store foam cork as the paper easily comes off okay so
I'm going to go down just draw the face just copy off the picture there I'm just
using a ballpoint pen put the nose in the details
got that sullen face the eye alright cool so now I've got those two a half's
draw and I'm gonna cut them out with the exacto just like I did with the door
just follow the lines it cuts very easily make sure use a sharp exacto with
this you don't want to tear the phone core from board cut everything out all
right good to go okay now I've got a little sculpting tool I'm gonna use this
to do some detail on this face I want to round the edge a little bit and then
pick out the details push them into the foam core to give it some dimension so
it's not just a flat looking piece of foam core right so this will help really
put that dimension into this into the foam core I'm just pushing in and I'm
getting angles on the phone core from the the large curve on the tool so there
we go nice okay and I did a little more detail on the top there which I didn't
have marked with the pen just pull that in so it's like I said it's got that
angular nice angle there kind of squishing it close to the detail there
we go you can see it in the light there okay now I have a rather large piece of
cardboard with scrap cardboard I'm gonna bend it to try to make the cliff that
the face is on okay so I'm just gonna bend it up don't worry you can't hurt it
there we go I'm pleased with it so now I need to cut the edge off
because in the picture it's like a cliff face so that the edges trimmed off so
I'm going to cut that off first now I've got the doors I've got the other doors I
cut out the secondary doors and you'll see why here right now because I'm going
to glue these faces onto the doors all right sweet nice
just hot glue those on wanna live make sure they line up so when you put it
together line them up there we go nice okay so here's my door now I need to
make an entrance for it so I'm gonna use the put it on the cardboard so I have
the exact size and then I'll just mark it with a pen and I'll know the exact
size to cut out now this can use my exacto and cut out
yeah there we go perfect fits perfectly alright now I want to have the doors
actually open so I'm gonna use a barbecue skewers okay I'm going to go up
through the corrugation at the edge of the door alright and then I'm gonna take
my my door here and I'm gonna do an indentation here into the side of the
door so that'll help it groove into that that pole there okay now I'm gonna hold
it for a sec so it sets up you wanna be careful you don't want to glue it to the
carb or you just want to glue it to that barbecue or skewer right so here's the
outer edge of the door the frame and I want to mark this so I can see where the
frame is when I put the when I build the rest of the cliff so I'm just marking
that for now I'm not actually gonna put it on yet okay now let's start adding my
own words glue all I've got a paper towel put it on there wet it down kind
of crinkle it up a bit I want to get a knife nice Rock cliff texture and I mean
you some 50/50 water down glue here and add some more glue to it and that'll
soak into the paper towel all right and then I'll just keep going around same
thing use a spray bottle wet it water down glue crinkle it up
cool it's really filling in now this looks like a huge mess but it's really
not that hard and once it dries up it'll be nice and strong okay so there's my
door and the edge of the door I want to get the runes in the door so I'm gonna
use the book to look at the runes on the edge there let's pull the paper off so I
can write into it with an ink pen and I want to leave a space for that block at
the top but I'm gonna start copying the runes from the picture into the door
there we go just fill those in you want to gouge in pretty deep with the pen
because you want to want those to show up nicely when you paint it you've all
seen me do this technique before just fall around the edge put all those runes
in cymbals there we go cool nice all right
now it's dried up the front is dried up but I want to put some braces on the
back to help support the curvature of the cliff so I'm just gonna hot glue
some extra pieces of cardboard on the back so this just be like some extra
reinforcement another piece of another stick of hot glue in there so there
that'll really help as far as reinforcing and keeping in shape without
having to do two layers right okay so just adding that in all right sweet
we're done now we'll move on to the next part in the next video hey I hope you
find these tips helpful if you did give your old DMC idea a thumbs up and that'd
be alike also check out my forum and Facebook group a bunch of wonderful
people on there and if you do like these vids consider tipping there is a little
tip thing on the video you can click on that and tip directly to your DM Scotty
and if you want to go take it further than that you can go to patreon and
become a supporter and a member of the family I have a monthly magazine called
the crafters lair which will have instant access to when you become a
supporter take care have fun gaming come on Madge let man I want it i want
treasure too
